ltl2rabin

Class MojmirAutomaton<T,L>

  • Object
    • ltl2rabin.Automaton<T,L>
      • ltl2rabin.MojmirAutomaton<T,L>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of information associated with a state, e.g. its corresponding LTL formula
    L - The type that represents the "letters", e.g. Set of Strings

    public class MojmirAutomaton<T,L>
extends Automaton<T,L>
    This class describes a Mojmir automaton. A description of a Mojmir automaton can be found in the paper "From LTL to Deterministic Automata -- A Safraless Compositional Approach" by Javier Esparza et al.

    A Mojmir automaton has a set of states, one initial state, an alphabet and accepting states.

    Usually, a MojmirAutomaton is constructed in a MojmirAutomatonFactory. F (the set of accepting states) is not computed explicitly. To check if a state is accepting, call the MojmirAutomaton.State.isAcceptingState(Set) method.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MojmirAutomaton.State<R,S>
      A MojmirAutomaton.State additionaly to a Automaton.State has a flag indicating if it is a sink or not.

      Once initialized, the fields of a MojmirAutomaton can not be changed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MojmirAutomaton

        public MojmirAutomaton(ImmutableSet<MojmirAutomaton.State<T,L>> states,
                       MojmirAutomaton.State<T,L> initialState,
                       ImmutableSet<L> alphabet)
        Once initialized, the fields of a MojmirAutomaton can not be changed.
        Parameters:
        states - The immutable set of states. The state parameters have to be the same as the automaton parameters.
        initialState - The entry point for the automaton.
        alphabet - The alphabet that was used to construct the automaton.
